description: High wooden clogs worn on stage by head puppeteers.
Body, torso, or framework of puppets.

label_ka: 下座あるいは囃子部屋
description: Small room over stage-right entrance occupied by offstage musicians.
Hourglass-shaped drum played at shoulder level with the hand.
Cue book listing puppeteer assignments and groupings.
Attaching puppet head and kimono to the puppet's framework.
Chanter or reciter.
Three stringed musical instrument.

notes: Used sparingly since all the performance photographs were taken during rehearsals. Used only for photographs where director and senior performers direct or train juniors during rehearsals and/or left-arm and leg manupulators appear without hoods on stage.

label_ka: 着到板あるいは到着板
description: A wooden panel with performer names indicating whether the performer has arrived.
Headgrip to which neck and head of puppet are permanently attached and from which toggles protrude.
Transverse harp with a wooden body and silk strings.
Flying performance by performer being suspended by wires.
Announcement performance.
Distribution/selection of puppet heads for roles.
Literally, shaded manipulator; denotes that all performing pupeteers appear on stage hooded and in the black robe (kuroko).

label_ka: バーバラ・カーティス・足立

description: For The Voices and Hands of Bunraku.

label_ka: デレック・バードサル
description: For The Voices and Hands of Bunraku.

label_ka: グレゴリー・ヴィティエロ
description: For The Voices and Hands of Bunraku.

label_eng: The Voices and Hands of Bunraku
description: By Barbara C. Adachi, Tokyo; New York: Kodansha International, c1978.

notes: Photographs of viewer seats, stage curtain, etc.

description: Three instruments: koto, kokyū and shakuhachi. Played in Bunraku by a shamisen player when a character in performance plays the instrument.
Revolving platform for narrators and shamisen players.
A device consisting of a wooden rod, a cord, and a lever attached to puppet's left arm.
Literally, east and west; hear ye!

label_ka: 足立インタビュー資料
notes: Barbara Curtis Adachi's interviews of Bunraku Troupe members.

description: Puppet manipulated by one puppeteer
